author: Seán McDaid
text:
I have sold a number of items, the value being over £200. I didn’t know that my bank account had been closed. Vinted Advised to set up a new account and they would redirect the money.
This has not happened. They asked for bank statements from both accounts, I did this, they then asked for a copy of my passport, I gave them a copy. Then they asked me to get verified, I did this. They then asked for details of the items sold, I went to my account where I discovered they had deleted a number of items. I had back ups.
Then they asked for bank statements again, back to the beginning! 
I asked why they could not identify the non payments from their accounting system, should be quite easy? No response.
What can I do?

author: Lisa
text:
I was really enjoying buying on Vinted so decided to use it when clearing out my house. Listed a lot of old and new things just make a little bit of money back from things I had that weren’t going to get used. Main thing I enjoyed about Vinted was that buyers are responsible for selecting and paying for their own shipping, all I had to do was print and post which took a lot of the hassle out of selling things and made more worthwhile. 

Last week a seller had messaged me to say an item she bought hadn’t arrived. As the 2 days were almost up for me to get the money transferred, I messaged customer service and asked them to hold the payment until I was able to resolve the issue for the buyer. I then messaged the buyer to inform them that I had requested for payment to be held. Next morning I wake up to a message from Vinted stating that it had been brought to their attention that I was using my profile for ‘commercial activity’ and to ‘generate a steady income’ and that my account/IP address had been permanently blocked. I had been selling on Vinted for 6 months and made £100 max. Definitely not a steady income nor indicating any commercial activity or ‘monetary gain’ - which is another no-no on Vinted apparently. 

Their guidelines states that users will be given a warning and they will seek to provide support before blocking users. This was not the experience that I had, my account was fully blocked and no warning given and no way to dispute their claims as apparently once you’ve been blocked, you cannot be unblocked. 

Overall, a really disappointing experience from such a huge platform who are pushing their advertising to get people to join but then placing a permanent ban so easily. Especially when there are many, many profiles on there which are actively and obviously using the site for commercial gain and face no consequences.
title: Blocked without warning, unable to dispute
